newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain sees 20.6 mln tonne '96 grains harvest.
newsitem.headline: Spain sees 20.6 mln tonne '96 grains harvest.

text.p: The Spanish Agriculture Ministry slightly adjusted its estimates for the combined total national production of maize, wheat and barley in 1996 to 20.6 million tonnes in September.
The Agriculture Ministry's latest monthly estimates predict a maize crop of 3.79 million tonnes, down from 4.00 estimated in June.
Total wheat production is now estimated at 6.17 million tonnes, up from 6.00 in June.
National barley production is estimated at 10.66 million tonnes, against 10.74 in June.
Maize alone is still being harvested in the north of Spain, and traders gauge that around 15 percent of the total crop has been collected so far.
This year's total crop is roughly double last year's, when Spain suffered from the effects of a severe drought. --Elisabeth O'Leary, Madrid newsroom +341 585 2160
